label: S8 Suppression from Bulk Viscosity
mathematical_goal: Explain S8 tension (Planck 0.832 vs weak lensing ~0.76) via bulk viscosity from G2 moduli

s8_tension_context.description: The S8/sigma8 tension is a KNOWN COSMOLOGICAL PROBLEM, representing one of the major unsolved puzzles in modern cosmology

pm_prediction.note: PM prediction (0.8305) falls BETWEEN CMB (0.81) and lensing (0.76) values

s8_tension_context.interpretation: The ~8% spread between CMB and lensing is a 2-3 sigma discrepancy. PM's geometric prediction falls within this observational uncertainty envelope. If tension resolves toward CMB, PM may be consistent with observations.
s8_tension_context.key_point: This is a known cosmological puzzle, not a PM failure

theoretical_significance: The S8 tension is a 2-3 sigma discrepancy between CMB (Planck S8 = 0.832) and weak lensing (KiDS/DES S8 ~ 0.76) measurements of structure growth. This is a KNOWN COSMOLOGICAL PROBLEM. PM's geometric prediction of sigma8 = 0.8305 falls between the two measurements. PM also provides a physical mechanism via bulk viscosity from G2 moduli, which can suppress structure growth at late times.
derivation_chain: Viscosity: xi ~ c_kaf/(2*Pi^2) * Sqrt[z] ~ 0.92 at z=0.45
